TO: NAEB BOARD OF DIRECTORS
Report #7
12-17-54
From:
Frank E« Schooley
Re: Proposed FGC Modification of Rules and^Regulations Governing
Television Auxiliary Broadcasting Stations.
On behalf of NAEB, Cohn and Marks have filed a reply in support
of the comments of JCET urging the FGC to make specific provisions
in its proposed rules which will permit the establishment of inter¬
city relay facilities by non-commercial educational stations
regardless of whether or not common carrier facilities are or
could be made available and regardless of whether or not these
non-commercial educational stations are located in either densely or
sparsely populated areas of this country. It is only by the
relaxation of the Commission’s now stringent Rule that efficient
arxi flexible state-wide networks of non-commercial educational
stations can be achieved*.
The filing of the reply came following informal discussions held
between officers, counsel, engineering committee chairmen and the
TV engineer. There may have been no formal Board action on this
matter but I assume there is practical unanimity on the desirability
of this action.
